newsitem.title: UK: Nigeria will not push for OPEC quota rise - OPECNA.
newsitem.headline: Nigeria will not push for OPEC quota rise - OPECNA.

text.p: Nigerian oil minister Dan Etete said on Thursday his country would not be pushing for a rise in its OPEC quota at the November 27 meeting in Vienna, the OPEC news agency reported on Friday.
Speaking on Nigerian television, he said OPEC must not be lured into raising its production ceiling because of a recent rally in prices.

Nigeria has an official OPEC quota of 1.865 million barrels per day (bpd), but produced 2.156 million bpd in August, according to an official Nigerian Department of Petroleum Resources report released on Tuesday.

OPEC ministers will be meeting in Vienna to set the group's output ceiling for at least the first six months of next year. Gulf sources and OPEC delegates have said it is unlikely that the group will change its ceiling of 25.003 mbpd in Vienna.
Etete also said that Nigeria's crude production capacity could rise to 3.1 million bpd with improved funding, although he did not specify when this might be achieved.
